meanings.sent1: The committee will reapprove the budget next week.
meanings.sent2: After reviewing the changes, the supervisor decided to reapprove the project.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally deleted the email with the approval, so I had to reapprove it.
meanings.sent4: Just like a teacher grading a paper, the manager had to reapprove the document for accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The software automatically prompts users to reapprove any changes before finalizing them.

meanings.sent1: The board will reapprove the proposal at the next meeting.
meanings.sent2: The principal had to reapprove the field trip due to safety concerns.
meanings.sent3: I had to reapprove the cookies my sister baked because they were so delicious.
meanings.sent4: The CEO had to reapprove the marketing campaign after the initial plan fell through.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor always double-checks and reapproves important documents before submission.
